wikipedia_page.main: Richard Fryer (11 November 1770 – 8 August 1846) was a Staffordshire banker, landowner and British Whig politician. He held a seat in the House of Commons from 1832 to 1835, representing Wolverhampton.

response: *Richard Fryer (1770–1846), banker, landowner and British Whig politician
*Richard Fryer (cinematographer) (1894–1953), born Morris Kolsky, British-born Hollywood cinematographer
* Richard Fryer (1770–1846) – local banker, landowner and British Whig politician; MP 1832–1835, for Wolverhampton
